intro: Ophiorrhiza kratensis, commonly known as the hairy root plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhizophoraceae. It is a small, shrub-like plant characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. Native to tropical regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a unique root system that includes aerial roots, which help it anchor in coastal or swampy areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing yellow or white petals.
